duck: Veliko Tarnovo University - The St. Cyril and St. Methodius University of Veliko Tarnovo is a Bulgarian university based in the city of Veliko Tarnovo.
Visvesvaraya Technological University - Visvesvaraya Technological University is an Collegiate state university in Karnataka State, India.

}} 'Visvesvaraya Technological University' ('VTU') is an Collegiate public state
university in Karnataka State, India. It was established on 1 April 1998 by the
Government of
Karnataka<ref>http://www.vtu.ac.in/newspaper/ConvocationPressNote2011.pdf</ref>
as per VTU Act 1994, to improve the quality of technical education in the
state.<ref
name=autogenerated1>http://vtu.ac.in/pdf/academic/publicnotice.pdf</ref> Apart
from a few notable exceptions, VTU has complete authority in the state of
Karnataka. It is a statutory requirement for colleges offering any program in
engineering or technology in the state to be affiliated with the university.<ref
name=autogenerated1 />

The university is named after Sir Visvesvaraya from Karnataka, the only engineer
to be awarded a Bharat Ratna award, the highest civilian award in India. Jnana
Sangama, [[Belgaum]] is the headquarter of VTU. Additionally, the university has
three regional centers located in Bangalore, Gulbarga and Mysore.

VTU is one of the largest universities in India with 208 colleges affiliated to
it with an intake capacity of over 67100 undergraduate students and 12666
postgraduate students. The university encompasses various technical & management
fields which offers a total of 30 undergraduate <ref name=autogenerated4>[http://vtu.ac.in/index.php/scheme-and-
syllabus/1383.html?article= ug scheme & syllabus 2010-11]</ref> and 71
postgraduate courses.<ref name=autogenerated5>[http://vtu.ac.in/index.php/scheme-and-
syllabus/1336.html?article= Scheme & Syllabus of PG Programmes - 2010-11]</ref>
The university has around 1800 PhD candidates.<ref>[http://www.vtu.ac.in/index.php/about-us/about-
vtu.html About VTU]</ref>

Presently, VTU has 13 QIP centers and 17 extension centers <ref></ref> in its
various affiliated colleges offering post graduate courses. It has around 2305
departments recognized as research centers which are spread across its various
affiliated institutions in different cities of Karnataka.<ref
name=autogenerated7 /><ref>http://vtu.ac.in/pdf/Circulars/list2011.pdf</ref> It
is one of the few universities of India to have 16 of its affiliated colleges
recognised by the World Bank for getting assistance in setting up state of art
laboratories, campus facilities and research centers under the TEQIP (Technical
Education Quality Improvement Programme, A Government of India initiative)
program.<ref name=autogenerated7 />

The university is administered by its Executive Council and Academic Senate
whose members are selected from the academic community and government
officials.<ref name=autogenerated2>[http://www.vtu.ac.in/index.php/about-us/governing-
bodies.html Governing Bodies]</ref> The present Chancellor of the university is
His Excellency, Sri Hans Raj Bhardwaj, Governor of Karnataka state and the Vice-
Chancellor is Dr. H. Maheshappa.<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref
name=autogenerated2 />

The Jnana Sangama, [[Belgaum]] campus and the regional and extension centers of
VTU at Bangalore, Davangere, Gulbarga and Mysore offer M.Tech, MBA, MCA and PhD
programs.<ref></ref><ref>http://www.kar.nic.in/kea/pgcet/MCA_Matrix.pdf</ref><r-
ef>[http://research.vtu.ac.in/degreeconferred.html Degree Awarded]</ref>

The University has signed MoUs with various Multinational corporation like IBM,
Intel Asia Electronics Inc., Ingersoll-Rand (India) Ltd., Bangalore, Nokia,
Bosch Rexroth and Microsoft to improve the industry interactions for both
students and the teachers.<ref name=autogenerated7
/><ref>http://vtu.ac.in/pdf/Circulars/brco.pdf</ref>

VTU is one of the member universities of the Association of Indian Universities
and Association of Commonwealth Universities.<ref>[http://www.minds-
india.org/aboutvtu.htm Minds - Visvesvaraya Technological University]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.co.in/books?id=Rs-
jsaPenxYC&pg=PA877&lpg=PA877&dq=VTU+in+Association+of+Commonwealth+Universities-
&source=bl&ots=Uq7sX51vrM&sig=NvMkxhVzKKYUAlO24KWNO6XDDnY&hl=en&ei=ZN-
KTomPH6bD0AGlvoHiBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CFQQ6AEwCDgK#v=-
onepage&q=VTU%20in%20Association%20of%20Commonwealth%20Universities&f=false
Handbook of universities - Ameeta Gupta, Ashish Kumar - Google Books]</ref>
